content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a function such that at each point <math alttext="x comma y " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> on the graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, the slope is given by <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals, y squared, minus x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>âˆ’</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> passes through the point <math alttext="with coordinates 1 comma 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and is concave down on the interval <math alttext="1 is less than x, which is less than 1.5 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Let <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the approximation for <math alttext="f of 1.2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1.2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> found by using the locally linear approximation of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 1 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements about <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is true?

choices.label: <math alttext="k equals 5.6 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and is an overestimate for <math alttext="f of 1.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1.2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="k equals 5.6 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and is an underestimate for <math alttext="f of 1.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1.2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="k equals 2.6 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and is an overestimate for <math alttext="f of 1.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1.2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="k equals 2.6 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.6</mn></mrow></math> and is an underestimate for <math alttext="f of 1.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1.2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="k equals 2.6 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and is an overestimate for <math alttext="f of 1.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1.2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 4.6: Approximating Values of a Function Using Local Linearity and Linearization

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Explain how an approximated value relates to the actual value.
